p: Moringa oleifera supplementation has a nutritional purpose, although it can provide other benefits to the product, such as improved digestibility [ 15], dough stability, antioxidant capacity, preservation, among other benefits associated with the plant [ 1]. The use in bread and biscuits is a very useful strategy to make up for nutritional deficiencies, due to the high consumption of these foods. In addition, the food industry has tried to reduce the consumption of wheat flour in bakery products, in order to deliver foods that provide better nutritional characteristics, including reduced gluten, and for this, Moringa oleifera seems to be an option [ 84].
